intro: Peschiera tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered pechiera, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Peschiera tenuiflora is often found in rocky or dry habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
